claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.
explanation: A two‐panel schematic comparing structural features of hemagglutinin (HA) from influenza virus versus recombinant HA (rHA) produced in insect cells. Panel a shows native HA as a heterodimer of HA1 (turquoise) and HA2 (orange) with complex‐type sialylated N‐linked glycans, cleaved fusion peptide (green), and inter‐disulfide bonds. Panel b shows rHA as a single precursor polypeptide (HA0) with amino acid sequence identical to wildtype HA, simpler paucimannose glycans, an uncleaved fusion‐peptide loop, and a disulfide bond. The figure describes structural and glycosylation differences between native HA and recombinant HA but does not address or demonstrate an identical antigenic match with WHO‐ or FDA‐selected strains, and thus does not support the claim. Note: The image focuses on molecular structure and glycosylation; it does not reference regulatory strain selection criteria or antigenic matching data.
